page.title: 13Buxhall - Former Windmill
page.content: Buxhall Mill ceased working as a corn mill in 1968, having been in one family 150 years. The present owner purchased it 7 years ago, moving from a nearby village. He was attracted by its potential as an unusual and aesthetically satisfying{family home, affording privacy and spacious accomm- odation. He also wished to preserve the windmill. In the{mill house}floors ceilings and many of the walls have been replaced and workshops used as additional living space. The site includes seperate stables, 2 and 3 storey outbuildings. The latter has been converted into 2{holiday {flats,}let for about 90% of the season March/Oct. There is still considerable restoration work to be carried out, notably to the mill which has now been made weathertight to curtail further deterioration.
